intro: Agelaea leopoldvilleana, commonly known as the Leopoldvillean Agelaea, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to deep red. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
